1.text: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold [where] they fine [it].

2.text: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass [is] molten [out of] the stone.

3.text: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.

4.text: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; [even the waters] forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.

5.text: [As for] the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.

6.text: The stones of it [are] the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.

7.text: [There is] a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture’s eye hath not seen:

8.text: The lion’s whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.

9.text: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.

10.text: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.

11.text: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and [the thing that is] hid bringeth he forth to light.

12.text: But where shall wisdom be found? and where [is] the place of understanding?

13.text: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.

14.text: The depth saith, It [is] not in me: and the sea saith, [It is] not with me.

15.text: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed [for] the price thereof.

16.text: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

17.text: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it [shall not be for] jewels of fine gold.

18.text: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom [is] above rubies.

19.text: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

20.text: Whence then cometh wisdom? and where [is] the place of understanding?

21.text: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.

22.text: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.

23.text: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.

24.text: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, [and] seeth under the whole heaven;

25.text: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.

26.text: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:

27.text: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.

28.text: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that [is] wisdom; and to depart from evil [is] understanding.
